skill.name: plot-consistency-checker
skill.description: Reviews plot structure, story beats, logic flow, and narrative continuity to identify contradictions, plot holes, pacing issues, or unrealistic elements.
skill.summary: Reviews plot structure, story beats, logic flow, and narrative continuity to identify contradictions...
skill.author: Amraha-Anwar

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only a SKILL.md instruction file. No executable code, network access, filesystem access, or external command execution capabilities. The behavior matches the stated purpose exactly.

content.user_title: Check story plot consistency and logic
content.value_statement: Stories often contain plot holes, contradictions, or pacing issues that weaken reader engagement. This skill systematically reviews narrative elements to identify structural problems and provide specific fixes.
actual_capabilities: Reviews plot structure and story beats for logical consistency
Identifies plot holes and unexplained coincidences
Checks character behavior against established motivations
Flags pacing issues and missing transitions
Provides actionable fixes for each issue found
limitations: Requires user to provide plot summary, chapter outlines, or scene details
Cannot evaluate unpublished or unwritten story ideas without content
Does not analyze grammar, spelling, or prose style
Relies on information provided; incomplete inputs may yield limited results

use_cases.title: Pre-publication review
use_cases.description: Authors review manuscripts for plot holes before querying agents or publishing.

use_cases.title: Script consistency check
use_cases.description: Screenwriters verify cause-effect chains and character motivations in screenplay drafts.

use_cases.title: World-building validation
use_cases.description: Game designers ensure consistent rules for magic systems, technology, or politics across story content.

prompt_templates.title: Basic plot review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this plot summary for plot holes, contradictions, and pacing issues. Provide a table with issue, explanation, and proposed fix.

prompt_templates.title: Character arc analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze these character arcs against the plot events. Flag any moments where character actions contradict their established motivations. List each inconsistency with a suggested fix.

prompt_templates.title: World-building audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate this story against its world-building rules (magic, technology, politics). Identify any scenes that break internal logic and suggest how to reconcile them.

prompt_templates.title: Full manuscript review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this full chapter outline with character arcs and world-building details. Check cause-effect flow, timeline consistency, transitions, and pacing. Output a comprehensive table of all issues with explanations and fixes.

output_examples.input: Review this plot: A detective solves a murder using clues that were never mentioned before in the story.
output: Issue: Deus Ex Machina Resolution â€” The detective solves the case using evidence never introduced to the reader.
Explanation: Readers feel cheated when solutions depend on information they could not have known. This breaks narrative contract.
Proposed Fix: Introduce the clue earlier in the story, perhaps as a seemingly irrelevant detail in an earlier scene that gains significance later.

best_practices: Provide complete context including character arcs, world rules, and chapter outlines for thorough analysis.
Focus on one specific aspect per review request for deeper analysis.
Iterate on fixes by asking for alternative solutions if the first suggestion does not fit your story.
anti_patterns: Submitting incomplete fragments without key plot events or character motivations.
Expecting grammar or prose style feedback; this skill focuses on structure, not prose.
Skipping world-building rules when reviewing fantasy or science fiction stories.

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Use in any conversational context where you discuss story content.

faq.question: What input materials should I provide?
faq.answer: Provide plot summaries, chapter outlines, character arcs, and world-building rules for the most thorough review.

faq.question: Can this check pacing as well?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill identifies pacing issues including scenes that move too fast, too slow, or have missing transitions.

faq.question: Is my story data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-only skill. No data is stored, transmitted, or accessed outside the conversation context.

faq.question: Why did the review miss some issues?
faq.answer: The skill can only analyze what you provide. Incomplete input leads to limited results. Add full context for best coverage.

faq.question: How is this different from general AI feedback?
faq.answer: This skill uses a structured framework with table-based output focused specifically on logical consistency rather than general writing advice.
